;这部好莱坞最新喜剧在中国掀起了一场罕见的关于女权的讨论热潮。

;

;这部电影由格蕾塔·葛韦格执导，玛格特·罗比和瑞恩·高斯林主演，讲述了芭比娃娃和肯离开芭比乐园，前往现实世界进行自我发现之旅的故事。除其他事项外，这部电影还取笑了《芭比之国》和现实世界之间的巨大差距，在芭比王国中，女性占据了从总统、最高法院法官到顶级作家等所有权力职位。世界”——角色肯在一个场景中难以置信地说道。

;

;自 7 月 21 日登陆内地影院以来，截至周五，该片的票房收入为 1.4 亿元人民币（1,960 万美元），自去年 12 月取消 Covid-19 控制措施以来，中国电影市场一直蓬勃发展。

;

;但在严格的外国电影配额和电影审查制度下进入中国市场的芭比娃娃电影监管机构的关注引发了围绕这部电影及其主题的讨论。讨论的核心是影片对有毒男性气质的呈现及其对女权主义的支持。

;

;它发生在中国女性在统治精英中的代表性可以说是最少的时候。自 10 月决策机构揭晓以来，数十年来首次在 24 名政治局成员中没有女性。

;

;这一举动并没有被忽视，联合国消除种族歧视委员会也注意到了这一点。消除对妇女歧视委员会 (CEDAW) 在 5 月份的一份声明中表达了其担忧，称“最高行政级别中没有女性”。

;

;虽然有关芭比娃娃的讨论都没有触及中国政治，但它可能据一位名叫洪千辰的微博用户称，最终她将成为喜爱粉色的芭比娃娃角色，她将“引领平权女权行动”。

;

;自电影上映以来，社交媒体上掀起了一阵热潮。 ，许多女性评论说，她们看到男性观众中途离开电影院，称这是因为电影中批评有毒男性气质的对话激怒了她们。

;

;在虎扑（一个以男性用户为主的体育论坛）上，超过3,500 人给芭比娃娃打了 5.6 分（满分 10 分）。

;

;但在中国热门电影评级网站豆瓣上，截至周四，芭比娃娃从超过 280,000 名用户那里获得了 8.5 分（满分 10 分）——高于任何评分

;

;豆瓣上一条被点赞超过 25,000 次的评论说：“你知道，中国女性没有多少机会看到纯粹女性视角的电影一些中国女权主义者认为，这部电影吸引了广泛社会阶层的观众，为中国公众讨论妇女权利和性别问题提供了一个难得的平台。< /p>;

;因敢于公开指控一位著名国家电视台性骚扰而闻名全国的编剧周晓轩表示，这部电影为中国女性提供了一个讨论性别问题的公共空间。

;

;

;

; p>;

;“每个女孩都可以和朋友一起去电影院讨论电影，”周说。 “尽管这部电影并不完全是关于女权主义的，但它在中国非常有意义。

;

;“这意味着每一个电影院都可以成为承载女权主义的空间。”

;

;周参与了一项活动中国#MeToo 运动中最引人注目的案例之一。 2018年，她指控中央电视台著名主持人朱军在她2014年在国家广播公司实习期间对她进行性骚扰。北京一家法院于 2021 年驳回了周的指控，并于去年以证据不足为由驳回了她的上诉。

;

;“我和很多女权主义者朋友因为芭比娃娃而团聚。周说：“去电影院是一项合法活动，任何人都无法阻止。”

;

;中国最受欢迎的播客之一《随机波动》的联合主持人张志奇表示，这部电影的价值更多在于它的内容。 “我只能说这是一部关于父权制的电影，”张说。 “作为女权主义者，我们看过更多有洞察力和开创性的电影，但它们不是面向普通观众的商业电影。”

;

;耶伦的女性权力午餐如何暴露中国在女权问题上的分歧

;

;张说，这种与女权主义相关的电影体验是新鲜的。

;

;围绕芭比娃娃的讨论与中国社会对与女权相关的批评声音普遍低兴趣或容忍度背道而驰。

;

;在中国流行文化中，直接触及性别的作品很少见，常常引起激烈争论或市场冷漠。

;

;单口相声演员杨莉，于2020年成名，以讽刺傲慢而闻名。在她的视频疯传后，她因外表而受到攻击，她代言的品牌也遭到了一些顾客的抵制。

;

;2017 年，一部讲述未成年人遭受性虐待的内地电影《天使穿白衣》赢得了冠军金马奖最佳导演奖，可以说是华语电影最重要的奖项，但在中国的票房收入仅为 2000 万元人民币（279 万美元）。

;中国国务院已就阻碍因素征求公众反馈国务院已就其可以“解决经济中的挑战和问题”的 10 个领域征求公众意见。 ”，并承诺调查和纠正私营部门的普遍投诉。

;

;建议强调了繁文缛节、市场准入门槛、公平竞争、地方政府保护主义、中国人民大学金融学院副院长赵锡军表示，政府和私营部门之间的定期沟通将有助于政策制定者有效解决问题.

;

;“中央和地方各级都有国有资产监督管理委员会，将国有企业和政策制定者联系起来，但私营部门没有这种机制，”他解释道。< /p>;

;“所以政府会通过不同渠道深入基层，直面困难。”

;

;新的行动计划能否为中国经济的脊梁插上腾飞的翅膀？飞得更高？

;

;就在两周前，北京通过31点行动计划向中国私营部门发出了最强烈的信息，誓言将为释放创业精神创造有利的环境。

;

; “民营企业发展是一个复杂的问题，涉及面广。”赵说。 “有的甚至成为了国际化企业，需要各种资源和支持。”赵说，民营企业主要关心的是整体营商环境和国有企业的作用、资源配置和政府支持。以及放宽外汇管制和配额。

;

;“尽管政府对私营部门的需求做出了快速反应，但私营企业的能力和竞争力在其加强发展的过程中也很重要”，他补充道。

;

;惠誉评级公司亚太区董事总经理王英在 7 月份的一份报告中表示，“支持私营部门增长的承诺......为当局的努力发出了强烈信号” ”。

;

;“但是，政策对投资和经济增长的影响将取决于这种方法的执行方式以及为支持政策目标而实施的详细政策，”她

;

;“杰出人物”：经济衰退之际，中国将给予私营部门更多发言权

;

;根据彼得森国际经济研究所的半年度追踪报告，中国在经济增长中所占的份额国有部门在全国100家最大上市公司中以总市值衡量仍在增加。它从去年年底的 57.2% 上升到 2023 年上半年的 61%。

;

;数据还指出，私营部门（定义为规模小于 10 家的企业）的比例2023 年上半年，国家所有权比例自 2019 年底以来首次降至 40% 以下。

;教皇方济各周日呼吁俄罗斯改变放弃黑海谷物的决定协议，根据该协议，尽管战争仍在继续，但它仍允许乌克兰从其海港出口粮食。

;

;“我呼吁我的兄弟，俄罗斯联邦当局，以便恢复黑海倡议，并方济各在每周的三钟经讲话中表示：“粮食可以安全运输。”俄罗斯于 7 月 17 日退出了这项由联合国和土耳其于 2022 年 7 月斡旋的协议，并开始瞄准黑海和多瑙河上的乌克兰港口和粮食基础设施。

;

;在圣彼得广场向人群发表讲话教宗敦促信徒继续“为受难的乌克兰祈祷，那里的战争摧毁了一切，甚至包括粮食”，称这是“对天主的严重侮辱”。

;

;世界近 14 亿天主教徒的领袖说“数百万遭受饥饿的兄弟姐妹的呼声冲天而起”。

;

;俄罗斯在表示要求放松对本国粮食和粮食的制裁后退出了黑海协议。化肥出口尚未得到满足。莫斯科还抱怨贫困国家没有获得足够的粮食。

;

;上周，俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京提出向非洲提供粮食，其中一些是免费的，但非洲联盟主席阿扎利·阿苏马尼，回应称这“可能还不够”。

;

;自去年乌克兰冲突爆发以来，方济各多次谴责俄罗斯的侵略战争，但也寻求与莫斯科保持开放的沟通渠道，但成果有限。

;

;5月，他任命意大利主教会议主席红衣主教马泰奥·祖皮(Matteo Zuppi)担任和平特使。祖皮迄今为止已去过基辅、莫斯科和华盛顿，并正在努力将儿童从俄罗斯和俄罗斯控制地区遣返回乌克兰。

; Sun, 30 Jul 2023 19:50:02 +0800 Huawei’s Android and Linux alternatives get boost from Shenzhen as China continues to wean itself off foreign techhttps://www.scmp.com/tech/tech-war/article/3229408/huaweis-android-and-linux-alternatives-get-boost-shenzhen-china-continues-wean-itself-foreign-tech?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.30 19:00;
;;

;中国南方科技中心深圳正在齐心协力推动运营的使用随着中国继续寻求减少对外国技术的依赖，深圳将努力吸引企业和人才来到这座城市，围绕 HarmonyOS 和 EulerOS 这两种开发的操作系统打造产业当地工业和信息化局在周五发布的一份行动计划中表示，该市希望到 2025 年消除关键操作系统对外国技术的依赖，并且根据规划，帮助HarmonyOS和EulerOS成为全球领先的软件。

;

;市政府还希望当年有超过10个行业和至少100家企业采用该操作系统。< /p>;

;华为更新Android系统，推出网约车平台

;

;为此，深圳将鼓励政府机构和国有企业在供水、交通等领域使用该系统。根据行动计划，开展教育。它还鼓励制造、互联网、金融、能源和医疗保健行业使用安装了这些系统的产品。

;

;该计划没有具体说明如何鼓励企业采用这些系统。

;

;HarmonyOS 是一种移动和物联网操作系统，也使用一些 Android 代码，于 2019 年华盛顿制裁华为、谷歌停止向该公司提供其移动软件服务套件后推出。

;

;EulerOS、专为企业服务器设计的 Linux 发行版于 2021 年首次发布。

;

;深圳的目标是拥有全市 40% 以上的新运营商“关键信息基础设施”（被认为对国家安全至关重要的系统）根据计划，到 2025 年使用 EulerOS。它还明确指出，鸿蒙操作系统应该在中国智能设备生态系统中占据“重要一席”。

;

;华为在普及其操作系统方面面临着一场艰苦的战斗，但随着国家加速推动鸿蒙操作系统，它正在慢慢取得进展。在美国出口和投资限制不断升级的情况下，中国摆脱了对外国技术的依赖。

;

;鸿蒙在中国的移动设备市场份额从 2021 年第四季度的 1% 增长到今年第一季度的 8%研究公司 Counterpoint 5 月份的一份报告显示。

;

;根据 Counterpoint 的数据，Android 和 iOS 在中国智能手机领域保持领先地位，第一季度分别占据 72% 和 20% 的市场份额。

;

; p>;

;华为7月26日透露，最新版本的HarmonyOS 4将于下周发布。

;

;EulerOS目前在130个国家和地区的安装量超过4.3亿，中国工业和信息化部在本月早些时候的新闻发布会上表示。

;

;相比之下，EulerOS 所基于的红帽企业 Linux 是最受欢迎的付费企业 Linux 发行版，约占三分之一据该公司称，截至 2019 年，该市场和所有商业服务器部署的一半。

;

;促进 HarmonyOS 和 EulerOS 在中国境外的使用是深圳计划的另一个目标。它希望到 2025 年参与中国“一带一路”倡议的国家和金砖国家（2009 年成立的新兴经济体，包括巴西、俄罗斯、印度、中国和南非）更多地采用该技术。

;香港一家私人补习公司突然倒闭，令数百名愤怒的家长和周日，困惑的员工们争先恐后地拿回钱，一些人呼吁政府介入。

;

;辉煌教育，在康怡、柴湾、筲箕湾、何文田和小西湾宣布其“历史使命已完成”，所有分行已于周六关闭。

;

;各分行门上贴有一系列通知，还提供了联系方式，供希望的顾客使用。获得任何优秀的学习材料、奖杯、奖牌或证书。

;

;联系该公司的家长表示，他们尚未收到回复，而《华盛顿邮报》的电话则无人接听。

;

;洪Kong DSE 2023：警方因考试评分计划泄露而逮捕老师

;

;顾客 Athena Chiu 表示，她已为女儿报名了康怡花园为期六个月的补习班，价值 12,240 港元（1,569 美元）分支。她补充说，课程原定从 8 月 1 日开始。

;

;公司的关闭让 Chiu 感到非常震惊，她说工作人员经常提前几天联系她，并提供折扣，希望她能购买更多课程.

;

;“现在很明显，这是他们从我们身上骗取最后一笔钱的最后一搏，因为他们当时怎么可能不知道他们即将倒闭呢？”她说。

;

;这位母亲补充说，家长们观察到康怡花园中心的课程直到周六早上仍在上课。她说，由于顾客纷纷赶到那里要求退款，该中心下午就关门了。

;

;周六晚上，顾客和工作人员建立了一个快速增长的 WhatsApp 群组，到下午 5 点，该群组成员已达到约 555 名

;

;该平台上的许多家长表示，他们不确定如何拿回钱，因为他们已经提前几个月支付了孩子的暑期课程和课程套餐费用。

;

;一些客户花费了高达 28,920 港元的私人学费套餐，其中还包括实地考察等额外费用，最多需提前七个月支付。

;

;Sonia Wong，她购买了价值 12,880 港元的课程9月至2月为她的孩子，说她通过社交媒体得知该公司即将关门。

;

;“大约两周前，玛格丽特仍在给我打电话，要求我报名参加更多课程，”黄说”，指的是辉煌教育的负责人彭紫东。

;

;“她会在深夜打电话，比如晚上 10 点。我记得告诉过她不要这么辛苦，现在我后悔了。”

;

;黄女士表示，她已经向警方和海关报案。

;

;“家教王”因高考泄密被判入狱14个月

;

;社交媒体上的照片显示，警察与恒隆地产的屋苑员工一起抵达康怡花园分行。

;

;消费者委员会表示迄今为止已收到一份与该事件有关的投诉。它补充说，通过信用卡付款的客户可以向银行申请退款，但警告说成功与否“取决于多种因素”。

;

;该委员会还提醒公众避免提前支付大笔款项

;

;大约十几名博睿教育员工也表示，他们被拖欠工资高达数万元，其中一名全职教师声称自己被自掏腰包74,400港元。

;

;该公司一位不愿透露姓名的兼职教师表示，按小时工作后，他被拖欠了“五位数”的工资。

;

;该公司他补充说，过去也拒绝根据他的要求向他提供合同。

;

;“我们实际上警告过一些来接孩子的家长，该中心似乎陷入了严重的财务困境因为许多员工面临工资拖欠或根本没有得到报酬，”这位老师说。 “但很多顾客已经提前支付了课程费用，所以他们被困住了。”

;

;前香港校长被控涉嫌辅导中心链接不当行为

;

;他说该公司不断告诉员工，预计新投资者很快就会加入。

;

;“老实说，过了一段时间我就不再相信他们了。我只是继续上班，因为我担心孩子们没有老师，我不想给其他员工增加更多负担。”他说。

;

;一位姓吴的前老师离开了辉煌教育在2019年底表示，今年并不是该公司第一次面临财务困境。

;

;吴于2018年9月加入该公司，表示最初未能设立强制性公积金账户或几个月后，他才提出这个问题。

;

;两个月前，我收到屋宇署关于防盗门的法定通知在我公寓的后门。这有点令人惊讶，因为自从我买下这套公寓以来，四分之一个世纪以来，那扇门从未有过任何修改。

;

;尽管如此，因为有人不厌其烦地签发了法定许可证通知，包括常见的一系列可怕威胁——巨额罚款、长期监禁等等——我认为最好去看看。

;

;门的问题立即显而易见。这是一种老式的外开式门窗，大概是前任主人几十年前安装的，一旦发生火灾可能会很危险，因为打开门窗会挡住狭小的后厅。

;

;门是非法的，必须离开。快速致电承包商后，他们拆除了旧门，订购并安装了一扇新的安全门，并向屋宇署提交了一份进度报告。所有这一切都是在六周内完成的。那么，一切都很好，只是心中挥之不去的怀疑，我们大家是多么幸运，能够在潜在危险的情况下生存了这么多年。

;

;似乎并不是每个人都那么谨慎和谨慎。及时处理此类事务。本月早些时候，旺角一座建筑物三天内两次发生混凝土坠落事件，第一次造成停放车辆内的人受伤，第二次造成道路堵塞。此后又发生了涉及其他建筑物的案件。

;

;在接下来的几天里，媒体报道揭示了令人震惊的情况。首先，屋宇署于2014年向该大厦发出强制检验令，最终委任认可人士进行勘察，并就需要进行的补救工程拟定报告。

;<工程招标工作已到位，但尚未指定承包商。 Nine years after the situation was deemed serious enough for an inspection order to be issued, no repair works have actually been done or illegal structures removed.

;

;That might not be the worst of it, either.掉落的混凝土来自一个正在建设中的新天篷（也是未经授权的）。换句话说，关于需要完成哪些工作的报告已经过时了。 Will that require another survey and a new tender exercise involving further delay?

;

;Stepping back from the individual case and looking from a wider perspective, we can see just how big the problem is. Some 7,000 buildings have been subject to a mandatory inspection order, but 4,000 have yet to complete it.

;

;Q&A: what makes an 'illegal structure' in Hong Kong, and how you can change a flat without breaking the law

;

;There is a subsidy scheme to help less-well-off residents of old buildings pay for the repairs. The Urban Renewal Authority, which administers the scheme, recently revealed that of the more than 1,100 applications it had approved, only 110 had completed the works as of January this year.

;

;This is a multifaceted problem which needs a multifaceted solution.第一部分必须是公共教育，向人们解释为什么他们需要爱护自己的财产。 Some people might feel their job is done once they have bought a flat, but real life is not like that.

;

;Maintaining your property as a real asset requires keeping it in good condition, and that costs money.由于许多公寓楼都有多个业主，业主立案法团可以帮助解决这个问题。 Ensuring there is such an organisation, and that it is up to the task, is a job for the Home Affairs Bureau under Secretary Alice Mak Mei-kuen.

;

;Judging from her comments last week, Mak is aware of the responsibility falling on her shoulders.这是一个需要长期不懈努力、乏味工作的领域。 We should all wish her well.

;

;However, the primary responsibility must rest with Director of Buildings Clarice Yu Po-mei and Secretary for Development Bernadette Linn Hon-ho.毕竟，我们谈论的是建筑安全，并间接谈论住房供应。 There is no point throwing all our energy into building new homes at one point of the supply process if existing ones are crumbling at the other.

;

;It is here that I perceive the major danger.尽管过去曾作出各种努力来划定界限，但违例建筑工程的情况仍处于失控状态。有人记得前任行政长官在担任较低职位时曾建议新界居民向政府登记所有此类作品吗？ Whatever happened to that scheme?

;

;All I see now in the New Territories is three-storey houses with structures on the roof. We have seen a candidate for chief executive with an unlawful basement so large it torpedoed his campaign, as well as a secretary for justice with properties which had such extensive alterations that overlooking them was not possible.

;

;Nobody wants an administration so overbearing that ordinary citizens responsible for non-dangerous, minor infractions in their own homes feel afraid, but we have to find a way to distinguish between minor, non-dangerous works that can be tolerated and alterations that pose a risk to others. Linn might be better placed to do this if she focused more on the big picture and less on destroying Hong Kong's world-class facilities at the Fanling golf course.

;Indian farmer Probir Mandal, 51, recently planted seeds of two traditional paddy varieties on his one-acre land in Kalitala, the last border village in the Sundarbans, the world's largest mangrove forest on the Indo-Bangladesh frontier.

;

;He is fervently hoping for rain, so he can transplant the gobindobhog and kamini seedlings into the field.

;

;“I'm keeping my fingers crossed for the rains,” said Mandal, who lost 25,000 Indian rupees (US$300) from low yields arising from unexpected drought, cyclone and floods over the past three years. “We have been cursed with erratic weather for more than a decade, making it extremely difficult to produce rice.”

;

;Why a delay to South Asia's monsoon is 'bad news' for global rice supplies

;

;To convey their desperation at the lack of rain and the changing weather pattern, Mandal and two other local farmers have written some 50 songs in Bengali, encapsulating the challenges of economically and socially marginalised farmers in the Sundarbans – a region commonly ravaged by rains, floods, cyclonic storms and cyclones caused by climate change.

;

;Part of Tridhara (which means “three tributaries” in Bengali), a cultural group formed in 1982, the three farmers composed bhatiali songs – a form of folk music to bring rivers and their communities to life – that describe the stories of struggle, loss and resilience of farmers in the Sundarbans.

;

;In one song, Mandal wrote: “Disastrous excessive rain, you destroyer, flooding my farmland, breaking my happy home … I am an unfortunate farmer, floating in my tears.” In another, he wrote: “Farmer provides food to the nation, death of a farmer is a stigma for the nation.”

;

;Tridhara co-founder farmer Palas Mondal, 58, said that little was known worldwide of the farmers in the Sundarbans, a region famed as one of the last habitats of man-eating royal Bengal tigers, but their songs will tell the world about human lives there.

;

;As part of a project titled RICE (Resilience, Innovation, Culture and Empowerment), initiated by The Eco Logical Foundation (ELF), the New Delhi-based non-profit in 2021 recorded 42 songs by Tridhara and filmed six videos featuring the singer-farmers. The songs and videos were subsequently released on YouTube, to bring Sundarbans' rice farmers closer to global rice consumers.

;

;ELF co-founder Pinaki Roy, who translated the lyrics of 19 songs into English, said farmers in the Sundarbans had been written off as “hapless” future climate refugees. But as nobody knew the land and the ecosystem better than these farmers, recording these songs was a “nascent attempt” to give them a voice and “sense of agency” to tell their own stories of resilience.

;

;Mondal said these songs highlighted the plight of farmers, who felt disempowered as the agriculture sector began to prioritise industrial farming processes and high-yield hybrid seeds. But the high-yield varieties failed to withstand the intrusion of saline water into the fields from nearby estuaries when river embankments break during floods or cyclonic storms, he said.

;

;Cultural and environmental geographer Mehebub Sahana, 33, told This Week In Asia that there was a higher frequency and intensity of tropical cyclones and storm surge floods in Sundarbans' coastal areas including Kalitala, because of global warming, climate variability and environmental change.

;

;“Climate change-induced cyclones, floods, salinity intrusion, land degradation and riverbank erosion along the coastal blocks of Sundarbans have affected people's livelihood,” said Sahana, a research fellow and lecturer at the University of Manchester.

;

;In 1999, after Cyclone Aila killed more than 78 people in West Bengal, Tridhara's singer-composer Bishnupada Sarkar, 65, wrote in a song: “Cruel Aila, you turned our golden [West] Bengal into a crematorium.”

;

;The cyclone had ravaged houses, fields, livestock, roads, grain storage and river embankments, and contaminated drinking water across Sundarbans.

;

;Asia must embrace technology to ensure solid food supplies amid climate change

;

;“Aila was the turning point in the life of people in Sundarbans,” Mondal said. “People started migrating to other states – Karnataka, Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh – to work as daily wagers in an unprecedented manner.”

;

;The downsides of forced migration are also described in Tridhara's songs.

;

;Sarkar said that farmers, who once accompanied him in traditional musical instruments while he sang, have also migrated to other states in search of work.

;

;Few like Mondal, who refused to migrate, remain in rice cultivation despite significant losses.

;

;Last year, Mondal lost 28,000 Indian rupees (US$340) to pesticide-free production of the traditional variety of black rice because of a lack of buyers.

;

;“We have no access to urban markets,” Mondal said. “中间商以边际价格从我们这里购买产品，但以高价出售给城市市场。 We can make no claim to their profit.”

;

;Changes in weather have forced many local farmers to switch to fish and prawn cultivation and poultry farming, while some have started driving public transport and running grocery shops to earn their livelihood, Sahana added.

;

;But Sahana said that it was important to archive songs about the daily struggles of people of Sundarbans because they reflect their perception of climate variability and climate change and their effects on ecological and socio-economic systems. “These songs will help to identify different vulnerable groups,” Sahana added.

;

;Archivist and singer Sourav Moni pointed out a lack of due recognition for talented artists of rural India, who sing the songs of land and river, and lead lives around them. “These songs need to be preserved, we cannot afford to lose them,” he said.

; Sun, 30 Jul 2023 16:20:02 +0800 China’s Poyang Lake marks earliest dry season on record, sparking drought concernshttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/science/article/3229393/chinas-poyang-lake-marks-earliest-dry-season-record-sparking-drought-concerns?utm_source=rss_feed

;China's largest freshwater lake has made its earliest start the dry season in more than 70 years, raising concerns of a repeat of drought conditions that shrank the body of water to just a quarter of its usual size last year.

;

;Located in the eastern province of Jiangxi, Poyang Lake entered its dry period on July 20, the earliest date since records began in 1951, and 17 days earlier than last year.

;

;According to the Jiangxi hydrological monitoring centre, the water level at the Xingzi hydrological station measured 11.99 metres (39.3 feet) on July 20, the lowest for the period since records began.

;

;Because of the continuous decline in water levels, the centre called for attention to the potential impacts and urged more efforts in water management and drought relief.

;

;Li Yankuo, a professor at Jiangxi Normal University's college of life sciences, said he was worried about the drought this year.

;

;“The water levels are relatively low because of less precipitation … From what I've seen so far, it feels like the drought is severe this year,” Li said.

;

;Poyang Lake is an important winter habitat for migratory birds, with hundreds of thousands of birds fly from the breeding grounds of northeastern Siberia to the lake to pass the winter each year.

;

;More than 350 bird species have been recorded at the lake, including 23 species listed in the International Union for Conservation of Nature's Red List of Threatened Species.

;

;The wetland is also a winter home for about 99 per cent of the world's critically endangered Siberian cranes and over 80 per cent of endangered Oriental white storks.

;

;But over the past decade, it has drawn attention because of its record-low water levels in late summer and autumn.

;

;Can China's parched Poyang Lake still be a winter home for migratory birds?

;

;The lake expands and shrinks due to seasonal water-level variations, from about 3,000 sq km (1,158 square miles) during the rainy season to less than 500 sq km in the dry season.

;

;The lower water levels during the dry season from October to March leave abundant plants, fish and other food sources available for migratory birds.

;

;However, over the past decade, the lake's water levels have fallen faster in late summer and autumn and its dry season has lengthened.

;

;Scientists have found that dams built on the upper reaches of the Yangtze River are a key contributor to the lake's earlier dry season.

;

;The dams – especially the Three Gorges Dam – start to retain water in September, resulting in lower water levels in the Yangtze and faster water flow from Poyang Lake to the river. As a result, the lake enters its dry season earlier.

;

;But in the past two years, the climate's role has grown as a cause of the lake's early dry season, according to Li.

;

;Last summer, China experienced its most severe drought and heatwave in six decades, sparking a hydropower shortage and affecting agricultural and industrial production.

;

;In 2022, Poyang Lake entered its dry season on August 6, 100 days earlier than the historical average.

;

;Plans revived for dam on Poyang Lake, cutting it off from Yangtze in dry season

;

;Hu Zhenpeng, former vice-governor of Jiangxi province and a professor at Nanchang University, said last year's drought in the region was the most severe since 1949.

;

;According to Hu's study published in the Chinese journal Drought Prevention and Relief in February, precipitation between July and October of 2022 was about one-third the average amount of rainfall for the same period over the past five decades. But evaporation was 34 per cent higher than the historical average.

;

;The lake's dry spell has resulted in more migratory birds stopping at artificial wetlands – lotus ponds or rice paddy fields – for food instead of natural wetlands, which may increase the risk of birds spreading viruses as they spend time closer to poultry, according to Li.

;

;He added that drought warnings and prevention were critical.

;

;“The negative impacts of drought are as severe as flooding. It will affect irrigation water, migratory birds and the ecosystem,” Li said.
